Title: Development & Admin Tools
Description: Tools for system administrators and developers.

Topics.Title: Developer Tools
Topics.Summary: Manage user feedback and system mappings.
Topics.Content:
Developer Tools

The Developer Tools form allows administrators to manage user feedback and system configurations.

User Feedback Management

View and manage bug reports, suggestions, and questions submitted by users.

  • Filter: Use the dropdowns to filter by Status (New, In Progress, Resolved) or Type (Bug, Suggestion).
  • Review: Select an item to view details and update its status.

Topics.Title: Database Maintenance
Topics.Summary: Tools for database migration and maintenance.
Topics.Content:
Database Maintenance

Warning: These tools are for advanced users only. Improper use can result in data loss.

Data Migration

Migrate data between databases (e.g., from Production to Test).

  • Bulk Migration: Migrate entire categories of data (Master Data, Users, Inventory).
  • Selected Tables: Choose specific tables to migrate.

Always ensure you have a backup before performing any migration operations.

Topics.Title: System Logs & Reports
Topics.Summary: View application logs and error reports.
Topics.Content:
System Logs & Reports

Access detailed system information for troubleshooting.

View Error Reports

Navigate to Development > View Error Reports to see a list of recorded application errors. This is useful for diagnosing crashes or unexpected behavior.

View Application Logs

Navigate to Development > View Application Logs to see a chronological log of system events. Logs are stored locally in CSV format and can be filtered by date or severity.
